content: It seems like I cannot upload files to my server. It says that the file is too large (it is less that 2MB). I know that there is a limit. Where can I change the setting? I couldn't find it anywhere.
The only related thing I could find in the shell by looking at the realm object was this: 'upload_quota_gb': None

Do you have the exact error message or can see where in the chain (nginx, zulip, ...) the error is generated?
The only zulip specific setting is in the settings.py: MAX_FILE_UPLOAD_SIZE = 25 (default)
You are right. I will check the error logs.
Default install, latest release, i had no trouble uploading 4mb through the webinterface
